00036 #include <fromsys.h>
00037 #include <banal.h>
00038 #include <splitfields.h>
00039 #include <datatypes.h>
00040 #include <bufvec.h>
00041 #include <cxops.h>
00042 
00043 #define SAMP_RATE (48000)
00044 #define HUGE_PHASE (1256637061.43593)
00045 
00046 #define RING_SIZE (01 << 022)
00047 
00048 pthread_t input,
00049           play;
00050 sem_t ready,
00051       reader,
00052       writer;
00053 
00054 jack_client_t *client;
00055 jack_port_t *lport,
00056            *rport;
00057 jack_ringbuffer_t *lring,
00058                  *rring;
00059 jack_nframes_t size;
00060 
00061 BOOLEAN playing = FALSE;
00062 double wpm = 18.0,
00063     freq = 750.0,
00064     gain = -6.0,
00065     ramp = 5.0;
00066 
00067 COMPLEX *zout = 0;
00068 
00069 // basic mapping, chars -> morse strings
00070 char *morse_table[128];
00071 
00072 // CW tone segments
00073 #define ME_EOF (-1)
00074 #define ME_ZERO (0)
00075 #define ME_RAMP (1)
00076 #define ME_STDY (2)
00077 
00078 struct
00079 {
00080     double wpm,
00081            rise,
00082            fall,
00083            curr,
00084            incr,
00085            rate;
00086     int type,
00087         size;
00088 } morsel;
00089 
00090 int ditspacesize,
00091     dahspacesize,
00092     ditstdysize,
00093     dahstdysize,
00094     charspacesize,
00095     wordspacesize,
00096     risesize,
00097     fallsize;
00098 double riseincr,
00099        fallincr;
00100 
00101 #define MAX_ESC (512)
00102 #define ESC_L '<'
00103 #define ESC_R '>'
00104 
00105 void inlinecmd( char *, int );
00106 
00107 void jack_ringbuffer_clear( jack_ringbuffer_t *, int );
00108 void jack_ringbuffer_restart( jack_ringbuffer_t *, int );
00109 void send_sound( COMPLEX *, int );
00110 
00111 //------------------------------------------------------------
00112 
00113 // try to map char -> morse string
00114 char *get_morse( int c )
00115 {
00116     return morse_table[c & 0x7F];
00117 }
00118 
00119 // translate text input to timed, sub-morse-element
00120 // audio segment specs; parcel the segments out
00121 // one at a time to the sound player
00122 void reader_thread( void )
00123 {
00124     BOOLEAN b = TRUE;           // we're coming from silence
00125     int c,
00126         e;
00127     char *m;
00128 
00129     // keep reading 1 char at a time
00130     while ( ( c = getchar(  ) ) != EOF )
00131     {
00132 
00133         // inline command?
00134         if ( c == ESC_L )
00135         {
00136             int i = 0;
00137             char buf[MAX_ESC];
00138 
00139             while ( ( c = getchar(  ) ) != EOF )
00140             {
00141                 if ( c == ESC_R )
00142                     break;
00143                 buf[i] = c;
00144                 if ( ++i >= ( MAX_ESC - 1 ) )
00145                     break;
00146             }
00147             if ( c == EOF )
00148                 goto finish;
00149             buf[i] = 0;
00150             inlinecmd( buf, i );
00151             continue;
00152         }
00153 
00154         // is char mapped to morse?
00155         if ( m = get_morse( c ) )
00156         {
00157 
00158             // yup
00159             // for each element in morse string
00160             // (dit/dah, doesn't matter)
00161             while ( e = *m++ )
00162             {
00163                 // first segment is ramp up...
00164                 sem_wait( &reader );
00165                 morsel.type = ME_RAMP, morsel.size = risesize;
00166                 morsel.curr = 0.0, morsel.incr = riseincr;
00167                 sem_post( &writer );
00168 
00169                 // ...then steady state...
00170                 // (choose dit/dah here)
00171                 sem_wait( &reader );
00172                 morsel.type = ME_STDY;
00173                 morsel.size = e == '.' ? ditstdysize : dahstdysize;
00174                 sem_post( &writer );
00175 
00176                 // ...then ramp down...
00177                 sem_wait( &reader );
00178                 morsel.type = ME_RAMP, morsel.size = fallsize;
00179                 morsel.curr = 1.0, morsel.incr = fallincr;
00180                 sem_post( &writer );
00181 
00182                 // ...finally, post-element pause
00183                 sem_wait( &reader );
00184                 morsel.type = ME_ZERO;
00185                 morsel.size = ditspacesize;
00186                 sem_post( &writer );
00187             }
00188 
00189             // post-character pause
00190             sem_wait( &reader );
00191             morsel.type = ME_ZERO;
00192             // (we already emitted a dit-sized space)
00193             morsel.size = charspacesize - ditspacesize;
00194             sem_post( &writer );
00195 
00196             // wherever we go next, it won't have been from silence
00197             b = FALSE;
00198 
00199         }
00200         else
00201         {
00202             // anything else treated as interword space,
00203             // which has only one segment (silence)
00204             sem_wait( &reader );
00205             morsel.type = ME_ZERO;
00206             // was previous output also interword space?
00207             if ( b )
00208                 // yes, use full duration
00209                 morsel.size = wordspacesize;
00210             else
00211                 // no, part of duration already played
00212                 morsel.size = wordspacesize - charspacesize;
00213             b = TRUE;
00214             sem_post( &writer );
00215         }
00216     }
00217 
00218   finish:
00219     // indicate EOF on input
00220     sem_wait( &reader );
00221     morsel.type = ME_EOF;
00222     sem_post( &writer );
00223     pthread_exit( 0 );
00224 }
00225 
00226 void sound_thread( void )
00227 {
00228     int i,
00229         k = 0;
00230     double ofreq,
00231            scale,
00232            phase = 0.0;
00233     COMPLEX z,
00234             delta_z;
00235 
00236     // keep looking for sub-element segments, one at a time
00237     for ( ;; )
00238     {
00239 
00240         // pause for next sub-element segment
00241         sem_post( &reader );
00242         sem_wait( &writer );
00243 
00244         // no more data?
00245         if ( morsel.type == ME_EOF )
00246             break;
00247 
00248         // requires playing some tone?
00249         if ( morsel.type != ME_ZERO )
00250         {
00251             // yes, reset params and
00252             // set up CORDIC tone generation
00253             ofreq = freq * 2.0 * M_PI / SAMP_RATE;
00254             scale = pow( 10.0, gain / 20.0 );
00255             if ( phase > HUGE_PHASE )
00256                 phase -= HUGE_PHASE;
00257             z = Cmplx( cos( phase ), sin( phase ) );
00258             delta_z = Cmplx( cos( ofreq ), sin( ofreq ) );
00259         }
00260 
00261         // play out this segment
00262         for ( i = 0; i < morsel.size; i++ )
00263         {
00264 
00265             // make silence
00266             if ( morsel.type == ME_ZERO )
00267                 zout[k] = cxzero;
00268 
00269             // make tone
00270             else
00271             {
00272                 z = Cmul( z, delta_z );
00273                 phase += ofreq;
00274                 // is this a ramping segment?
00275                 if ( morsel.type == ME_RAMP )
00276                 {
00277                     morsel.curr += morsel.incr;
00278                     zout[k] =
00279                         Cscl( z, scale * sin( morsel.curr * M_PI / 2.0 ) );
00280                 }
00281                 else
00282                     zout[k] = Cscl( z, scale );
00283             }
00284 
00285             // have we played enough to fill a jack buffer?
00286             if ( ++k >= size )
00287             {
00288                 // yes, send to output
00289                 send_sound( zout, k );
00290                 // wait until some audio has been drained
00291                 sem_wait( &ready );
00292                 k = 0;
00293                 if ( morsel.type != ME_ZERO )
00294                 {
00295                     // reset CORDIC
00296                     if ( phase > HUGE_PHASE )
00297                         phase -= HUGE_PHASE;
00298                     z = Cmplx( cos( phase ), sin( phase ) );
00299                     delta_z = Cmplx( cos( ofreq ), sin( ofreq ) );
00300                 }
00301             }
00302         }
00303     }
00304 
00305     // anything left unsent?
00306     if ( k > 0 )
00307         send_sound( zout, k );
00308 
00309     pthread_exit( 0 );
00310 }

00314 void jack_ringbuffer_clear( jack_ringbuffer_t * ring, int nbytes )
00315 {
00316     int i;
00317     char zero = 0;
00318 
00319     for ( i = 0; i < nbytes; i++ )
00320         jack_ringbuffer_write( ring, &zero, 1 );
00321 }
00322 
00323 void jack_ringbuffer_restart( jack_ringbuffer_t * ring, int nbytes )
00324 {
00325     jack_ringbuffer_reset( ring );
00326     jack_ringbuffer_clear( ring, nbytes );
00327 }
00328 
00329 void send_sound( COMPLEX * buff, int len )
00330 {
00331     if ( jack_ringbuffer_write_space( lring ) < len * sizeof( float ) )
00332     {
00333         write( 2, "overrun\n", 8 );
00334         jack_ringbuffer_restart( lring, size * sizeof( float ) );
00335         jack_ringbuffer_restart( rring, size * sizeof( float ) );
00336     }
00337     else
00338     {
00339         int i;
00340 
00341         for ( i = 0; i < len; i++ )
00342         {
00343             float l = buff[i].re,
00344                 r = buff[i].im;
00345             jack_ringbuffer_write( lring, ( char * ) &l, sizeof( float ) );
00346             jack_ringbuffer_write( rring, ( char * ) &r, sizeof( float ) );
00347         }
00348     }
00349 }
00350 
00351 PRIVATE void jack_xrun( void *arg )
00352 {
00353     char *str = "xrun!\n";
00354 
00355     write( 2, str, strlen( str ) );
00356 }
00357 
00358 PRIVATE void jack_shutdown( void *arg )
00359 {
00360 }
00361 
00362 PRIVATE void jack_callback( jack_nframes_t nframes, void *arg )
00363 {
00364     char *lp,
00365         *rp;
00366     int nwant = nframes * sizeof( float ),
00367         nhave = jack_ringbuffer_read_space( lring );
00368 
00369     lp = jack_port_get_buffer( lport, nframes );
00370     rp = jack_port_get_buffer( rport, nframes );
00371     if ( nhave >= nwant )
00372     {
00373         jack_ringbuffer_read( lring, lp, nwant );
00374         jack_ringbuffer_read( rring, rp, nwant );
00375         sem_post( &ready );
00376     }
00377     else
00378     {
00379         memset( lp, 0, nwant );
00380         memset( rp, 0, nwant );
00381     }
00382 }
00383 
00384 void resetparam( void )
00385 {
00386     morsel.wpm = wpm;
00387     morsel.rise = morsel.fall = ramp;
00388     morsel.rate = SAMP_RATE;
00389 
00390     ditspacesize = SAMP_RATE * 1.2 / morsel.wpm + 0.5;
00391     dahspacesize = 3 * ditspacesize;
00392     charspacesize = dahspacesize;
00393     wordspacesize = 7 * ditspacesize;
00394 
00395     risesize = SAMP_RATE * morsel.rise / 1e3 + 0.5;
00396     if ( risesize > 1 )
00397         riseincr = 1.0 / ( risesize - 1 );
00398     else
00399         riseincr = 1.0;
00400 
00401     fallsize = SAMP_RATE * morsel.fall / 1e3 + 0.5;
00402     if ( fallsize > 1 )
00403         fallincr = -1.0 / ( fallsize - 1 );
00404     else
00405         fallincr = -1.0;
00406 
00407     ditstdysize = ditspacesize - risesize - fallsize;
00408     dahstdysize = dahspacesize - risesize - fallsize;
00409 }
00410 
00411 int main( int argc, char **argv )
00412 {
00413     int i;
00414 
00415     for ( i = 1; i < argc; i++ )
00416         if ( argv[i][0] == '-' )
00417             switch ( argv[i][1] )
00418             {
00419             case 'f':
00420                 freq = atof( argv[++i] );
00421                 break;
00422             case 'w':
00423                 wpm = atof( argv[++i] );
00424                 break;
00425             case 'g':
00426                 gain = atof( argv[++i] );
00427                 break;
00428             case 'r':
00429                 ramp = atof( argv[++i] );
00430                 break;
00431             default:
00432                 fprintf( stderr,
00433                          "keyboard-keyer [-w wpm] [-f freq] [-g gain_dB] [-r ramp_ms] [infile]\n" );
00434                 exit( 1 );
00435             }
00436         else
00437             break;
00438 
00439     if ( i < argc )
00440     {
00441         if ( !freopen( argv[i], "r", stdin ) )
00442             perror( argv[i] ), exit( 1 );
00443         i++;
00444     }
00445 
00446     //------------------------------------------------------------
00447 
00448     resetparam(  );
00449 
00450     //------------------------------------------------------------
00451 
00452     if ( !( client = jack_client_new( "kkyr" ) ) )
00453         fprintf( stderr, "can't make client -- jack not running?\n" ),
00454             exit( 1 );
00455     jack_set_process_callback( client, ( void * ) jack_callback, 0 );
00456     jack_on_shutdown( client, ( void * ) jack_shutdown, 0 );
00457     jack_set_xrun_callback( client, ( void * ) jack_xrun, 0 );
00458     size = jack_get_buffer_size( client );
00459 
00460     lport =
00461         jack_port_register( client, "ol", JACK_DEFAULT_AUDIO_TYPE,
00462                             JackPortIsOutput, 0 );
00463     rport =
00464         jack_port_register( client, "or", JACK_DEFAULT_AUDIO_TYPE,
00465                             JackPortIsOutput, 0 );
00466     lring = jack_ringbuffer_create( RING_SIZE );
00467     rring = jack_ringbuffer_create( RING_SIZE );
00468     jack_ringbuffer_clear( lring, size * sizeof( float ) );
00469     jack_ringbuffer_clear( rring, size * sizeof( float ) );
00470 
00471     //------------------------------------------------------------
00472 
00473     zout = newvec_COMPLEX( size, "keyb sample buffer" );
00474 
00475     //------------------------------------------------------------
00476 
00477     sem_init( &ready, 0, 0 );
00478     sem_init( &reader, 0, 0 );
00479     sem_init( &writer, 0, 0 );
00480     pthread_create( &input, 0, ( void * ) reader_thread, 0 );
00481     pthread_create( &play, 0, ( void * ) sound_thread, 0 );
00482 
00483     //------------------------------------------------------------
00484 
00485     jack_activate( client );
00486     {
00487         const char **ports;
00488 
00489         if ( !
00490              ( ports =
00491                jack_get_ports( client, 0, 0,
00492                                JackPortIsPhysical | JackPortIsInput ) ) )
00493         {
00494             fprintf( stderr, "can't find any physical playback ports\n" );
00495             exit( 1 );
00496         }
00497         if ( jack_connect( client, jack_port_name( lport ), ports[0] ) )
00498         {
00499             fprintf( stderr, "can't connect left output\n" );
00500             exit( 1 );
00501         }
00502         if ( jack_connect( client, jack_port_name( rport ), ports[1] ) )
00503         {
00504             fprintf( stderr, "can't connect right output\n" );
00505             exit( 1 );
00506         }
00507         free( ports );
00508     }
00509 
00510     pthread_join( input, 0 );
00511     pthread_join( play, 0 );
00512     jack_client_close( client );
00513 
00514     //------------------------------------------------------------
00515 
00516     delvec_COMPLEX( zout );
00517 
00518     //------------------------------------------------------------
00519 
00520     jack_ringbuffer_free( lring );
00521     jack_ringbuffer_free( rring );
00522     sem_destroy( &ready );
00523     sem_destroy( &reader );
00524     sem_destroy( &writer );
00525 
00526     //------------------------------------------------------------
00527 
00528     exit( 0 );
00529 }

00531 char *morse_table[128] = {
00532     /* 000 NUL */ 0, /* 001 SOH */ 0, /* 002 STX */ 0, /* 003 ETX */ 0,
00533     /* 004 EOT */ 0, /* 005 ENQ */ 0, /* 006 ACK */ 0, /* 007 BEL */ 0,
00534     /* 008  BS */ 0, /* 009  HT */ 0, /* 010  LF */ 0, /* 011  VT */ 0,
00535     /* 012  FF */ 0, /* 013  CR */ 0, /* 014  SO */ 0, /* 015  SI */ 0,
00536     /* 016 DLE */ 0, /* 017 DC1 */ 0, /* 018 DC2 */ 0, /* 019 DC3 */ 0,
00537     /* 020 DC4 */ 0, /* 021 NAK */ 0, /* 022 SYN */ 0, /* 023 ETB */ 0,
00538     /* 024 CAN */ 0, /* 025  EM */ 0, /* 026 SUB */ 0, /* 027 ESC */ 0,
00539     /* 028  FS */ 0, /* 029  GS */ 0, /* 030  RS */ 0, /* 031  US */ 0,
00540     /* 032  SP */ 0,
00541                                 /* 033   ! */ "...-.",
00542                                 // [SN]
00543     /* 034   " */ 0,
00544     /* 035   # */ 0,
00545     /* 036   $ */ 0,
00546                                 /* 037   % */ ".-...",
00547                                 // [AS]
00548     /* 038   & */ 0,
00549     /* 039   ' */ 0,
00550                                 /* 040   ( */ "-.--.",
00551                                 // [KN]
00552     /* 041   ) */ 0,
00553                                 /* 042   * */ "...-.-",
00554                                 // [SK]
00555                                 /* 043   + */ ".-.-.",
00556                                 // [AR]
00557     /* 044   , */ "--..--",
00558     /* 045   - */ "-....-",
00559     /* 046   . */ ".-.-.-",
00560     /* 047   / */ "-..-.",
00561     /* 048   0 */ "-----",
00562     /* 049   1 */ ".----",
00563     /* 050   2 */ "..---",
00564     /* 051   3 */ "...--",
00565     /* 052   4 */ "....-",
00566     /* 053   5 */ ".....",
00567     /* 054   6 */ "-....",
00568     /* 055   7 */ "--...",
00569     /* 056   8 */ "---..",
00570     /* 057   9 */ "----.",
00571     /* 058   : */ 0,
00572     /* 059   ; */ 0,
00573     /* 060   < */ 0,
00574                                 /* 061   = */ "-...-",
00575                                 // [BT]
00576     /* 062   > */ 0,
00577                                 /* 063   ? */ "..__..",
00578                                 // [IMI]
00579     /* 064   @ */ ".--.-.",
00580     /* 065   A */ ".-",
00581     /* 066   B */ "-...",
00582     /* 067   C */ "-.-.",
00583     /* 068   D */ "-..",
00584     /* 069   E */ ".",
00585     /* 070   F */ "..-.",
00586     /* 071   G */ "--.",
00587     /* 072   H */ "....",
00588     /* 073   I */ "..",
00589     /* 074   J */ ".---",
00590     /* 075   K */ "-.-",
00591     /* 076   L */ ".-..",
00592     /* 077   M */ "--",
00593     /* 078   N */ "-.",
00594     /* 079   O */ "---",
00595     /* 080   P */ ".--.",
00596     /* 081   Q */ "--.-",
00597     /* 082   R */ ".-.",
00598     /* 083   S */ "...",
00599     /* 084   T */ "-",
00600     /* 085   U */ "..-",
00601     /* 086   V */ "...-",
00602     /* 087   W */ ".--",
00603     /* 088   X */ "-..-",
00604     /* 089   Y */ "-.--",
00605     /* 090   Z */ "--..",
00606     /* 091   [ */ 0,
00607     /* 092   \ */ 0,
00608     /* 093   ] */ 0,
00609     /* 094   ^ */ 0,
00610     /* 095   _ */ 0,
00611     /* 096   ` */ 0,
00612     /* 097   a */ ".-",
00613     /* 098   b */ "-...",
00614     /* 099   c */ "-.-.",
00615     /* 100   d */ "-..",
00616     /* 101   e */ ".",
00617     /* 102   f */ "..-.",
00618     /* 103   g */ "--.",
00619     /* 104   h */ "....",
00620     /* 105   i */ "..",
00621     /* 106   j */ ".---",
00622     /* 107   k */ "-.-",
00623     /* 108   l */ ".-..",
00624     /* 109   m */ "--",
00625     /* 110   n */ "-.",
00626     /* 111   o */ "---",
00627     /* 112   p */ ".--.",
00628     /* 113   q */ "--.-",
00629     /* 114   r */ ".-.",
00630     /* 115   s */ "...",
00631     /* 116   t */ "-",
00632     /* 117   u */ "..-",
00633     /* 118   v */ "...-",
00634     /* 119   w */ ".--",
00635     /* 120   x */ "-..-",
00636     /* 121   y */ "-.--",
00637     /* 122   z */ "--..",
00638     /* 123   { */ 0,
00639     /* 124   | */ 0,
00640     /* 125   } */ 0,
00641     /* 126   ~ */ 0,
00642     /* 127 DEL */ 0
00643 };
00644 
00645 void inlinecmd( char *buf, int len )
00646 {
00647     if ( !buf || len < 1 )
00648         return;
00649     if ( !strncmp( buf, "wpm", 3 ) )
00650     {
00651         wpm = atof( buf + 3 );
00652         resetparam(  );
00653     }
00654     else if ( !strncmp( buf, "ramp", 4 ) )
00655     {
00656         ramp = atof( buf + 4 );
00657         resetparam(  );
00658     }
00659     else if ( !strncmp( buf, "freq", 4 ) )
00660         freq = atof( buf + 4 );
00661     else if ( !strncmp( buf, "gain", 4 ) )
00662         gain = atof( buf + 4 );
00663 }
